Message: Add changelog to "Help" mode
Menu entries to clear CPU/Memory
Re-enabled ability to view licenses of included Products
Added Web Assembly builds, deployed regularly to https://compsys-pep.com/
Added ability to filter help items to a selected abstraction & architecture
Changed default monospace font to Courier Prime
Use system's colors in native menu bars
Improve Web Assembly download speeds by reducing build size
Clear debugger's CPU & Memory on start of new simulation
Fixed higlighting of mode buttons on application startup
In assembly source editor, style text using theme's italic/bold settings
Import syntax highlighting colors from Pep/9
On menu items: "Build > Execute", or "Debug > Start Debugging", switch active mode to "Debugger"
Add menu entry "Build > Assemble then Load Object Code"
Hide menu entry "Build > Format Object Code" when not in ISA3 project
Enable projects for "Pep/10, Asmb3, bare metal"
Reduce vertical clipping in debugger's CPU pane
Remove alternate column color bands from Memory Hex Dump
Add Symbol Table Viewer to Debugger
Replace icons on "Welcome" mode cards with abstraction-specific artwork
In "Welcome" mode, create uniform grid layout for abstractions and levels
Prevent "Build > Format Object Code" from deleting all object code in some cases
Increase size of icons in application toolbar
Display project's architecture and abstraction in tab control
In WASM builds, use our Pepp logo instead of Qt's default logo
In "Welcome" mode, add meaningful descriptions to enabled cards
Add "What's New" dialog on startup, highlighting changes since the app was last used
Made custom themes persistent between sessions in WASM
Re-order "Welcome" mode cards to match order of presentation in text
Remove banding for "Help" rows
In assembler symbol tables, differentiate between user program and OS symbols
Only show relevant changes in "What's New" startup dialog
Update to Qt 6.8
In "Welcome" mode, split double-wide Mc2 into two labeled columns
Added Pep/9 projects for ISA3 and Asmb5
Added step over/into/out for ISA and ASMB5
Removed Pep/10 OS's loader and diskIn port
Add stack trace to "Debugger" mode, containing views of globals, heap, and stack
Redesign application preferences & styling
In "Debugger" mode, add labels to stack trace
Fix copy/paste in assembly editor
Re-added ability to save ISA3/ASMB3/ASMB5 projects to the filesystem
Re-added descriptions to figures in the help system
Fix off-by-1 when stopping for breakpoints
Increase width of CPU pane in web version
Prevent text overflow in Batch IO pane
Hide unimplemented menus & panes
Hide tab bar in "Welcome" mode
Improve clickability of "Welcome" project cards
Improve spacing of menus in web version
Tighten layout of CPU register view
Remove leading "0"'s from figure names
Temporarily disable Pep/10 projects
Prevent disappearing text in memory dump
Prevent batch output from disappearing at small resolutions
Fix incorrect help system filter on first use
Standardize width of help system's rows
Expand help system items on click
Make Pep/10 default architecture
Add base tooltip to byte converters
Add data type selection to CPU register view
Prevent panning beyond bounds of CPU register view
Prevent panning beyond bounds of Help system
Replace Pep/10 instruction "SWAPSPA" with "MOVASP"
Prevent application icon from becoming all-black on Mac OS
Deploy both Intel and Apple Silicon builds for Mac OS
"Add icons to mode selection buttons"
Add new entitlements to Mac OS application bundle
Reduce complexity of initial project creation
Capitalize name in Mac OS application bundle
In help system, freely allow users to change abstraction and architecture filters
Add macro browser to Pep/10 help documentation
Prevent editing of read-only figures in help system
Add "Assemble" button to toolbar
Make symbol table viewer resizable
More tightly group symbol:value pairs in symbol table viewer
Add ability to copy symbol table as formatted text
Allow copy/cut/paste across all controls, not just the assembly editor
Disable cut/paste for read-only controls
Increase contrast between text and background for disabled controls
Prevent most theme items from defaulting to monospaced fonts
Change default monospace font to GitHub's "Monaspace Xenon" font
Distinguish macro expansions from user code via different fonts
Improve spacing within listing's macro expansions
Re-order Pep/10 opcodes to group together AAA-type ops
Convert chapter 7 figures from Java to Python for the 6th edition
Allow copying themes other than "Dark"
Update entries in theme managemer after copying a theme
Allow app developers to provide a custom figure directory
In Pep/10, use \0 as null terminator rather than \x00
Add a watch expressions pane to allow users to inspect change to variables and registers
Upgrade application to use Qt 6.9
Prevent text clipping between columns in watch expression pane
Reduce memory usage for watch expressions
Recompute stale watch expressions at simulation start
Add ability to remove watch expressions
Preserve watch expressions which contain syntactic errors
Added breakpoint viewer to allow users to inspect breakpoints
Using the breakpoint viewer, allow usrs to add and modify breakpoint conditional expressions
In Pep/9, do not clear high order byte in `LDBr`
Increase spacing between columns of (symbol, value) pairs in symbol table
Add command line utility to inspect details of Pep/10 object code
Fix a bug where OS symbols appear in the user's symbol table
Fix a bug where some user program lines do not accept breakpoints
Differentiate conditional and unconditional breakpoints in editor
Move `NOTr` after `ASRr` in Pep/10 ISA
Distinguish macro expansions from user code via italics rather than a different font
Fix a bug where memory dump does not use a monospaced font
Change default monospace font to GitHub's "Monaspace Argon" font for increased legibility
Modernize app icon
Fix a bug where ISA3 projects would not simulate
In the debugger's CPU pane, replace NZVC checkboxes with text field containing 0 or 1
Decrease spacing between mnemonics and addressing modes in register pane and byte converters
In ISA3 editor, enable copy/cut/paste
In ISA3 editor, allow arbitrary white space between octets
In help system, remove impossible filter combinations
In Debugger's CPU pane, changed signedness of operand specifier based on addressing mode
In Debugger's CPU pane, modify alignment between status bits and registers
Give focus to text editors on creating new project or changing mode
In ISA3 editor, add table showing instruction descriptions and their bit patterns
Make WASM version available offline by installing as a progressive web app (PWA)
In Debugger's CPU pane, center registers and status bits horizontally on resize
Allow users to change the layout of the editor and debugger
No longer require sentinel ZZ in object code editor
In "Welcome" view, emphasize editions of book rather than architectures
In ISA3 editor, match instruction table formatting to that of the book
Enable iOS builds
Refactor "Welcome" view's layout to be responsive to window size
Re-enable theming in WASM builds
Standardize listing to 79 characters per line
Use current theme in symbol table
Copying from symbol table always formats to 2 columns
Add line numbers to object code only lines
Use symbols in CHARI and CHARO macros
Align macro start comments to listing columns
Make macro names case-insensitive
Allow runtime generation of figure fragments
Add CLI tool to assemble and run microcode programs
Prevent DECI hangs by adding padding whitespace to batch input
Align macro end comments to listing columns
Reenable "Assemble then Format" menu action
Add CLI tool to synchronize textbook figures with this repo
Reduce macro expansion size for macro invocations with symbol declarations
Macro names use SCREAMING_SNAKE case in comments
Prevent macro expansion when formatting source code
Add icons to associated file types on Mac OS and enabled their previews in finder
Added a dialog to disambiguate files with multiple possible projects
Track recently opened and saved files in "File" menu
Added "save as" options for secondary project outputs (e.g., a pepl as ASMB5)
Prompt users to save project contents on close
A project's changed/dirty/asterisk/* applies more quickly after editing
Pep/10's SCALL now pushes the whole IR rather than only the leading 8 bits
Optimized system call dispatch in the Pep/10 OS
Saving files is now possible on Mac OS
"Fix off-by-1 formatting bug for macro source code"
Add file type associations for Windows
Add robust type system to expression evaluators
Prevent spurious line wrapping inside of installer license viewer
Combine "What's New" and "About" into a single dialog
Add gradient to mode selection bar
Add diagnostic information to CLI (`pepp-term about`)
Introduce a new heirarchical layout for the help topics
Renamed `Register Dump` to `CPU Dump`
Restyle mode buttons to make the active mode more obvious
The menu item "Remove all Breakpoints" now works as suggsted
Unify styling of help content with the rest of the application
Update all help content for Pep/10 and the 6th edition
Include software license agreement in Mac OS installers
Reduce width of pane visibility buttons in the `Editor` and `Debugger` modes.
Reduce vibrancy of UI component higlights
Replace status message in bottom right corner with a `Messages` pane
Add "Show All" filter to help system
Do not resize panes when switching between modes
Flash tab buttons and visibility controls on new messages
Add ability to reset broken themeing via a "Help" menu item
Renamed `CPU Dump` to `Dump`
Overhaul "Welcome" mode, reducing button sizes and adding recent + favorite files
Hide project types & help items for levels of abstraction introduced after chapter 4
Change coloring of docking widget title bars to match the window base color
Enable undo & redo for assembly code editors
Increase font size of headers in "Welcome" mode
Remove leading 0's from figure names in "Welcome" mode
Use uppercase hex strings in byte converters
Increase contrast of text in enabled visibility controls
Fixed memory highlighting bug for initial PC/SP values
Install MSVC redistributables with Windows installer
Update chapter 5 figures to match Computer Systems text
Hide OS in ASMB3/ASMB5 projects
Do not allow stepping into OS in ASMB3/ASMB5 projects
Provide better error messages on lexical analysis + parsing errors
Ensure consistent capitalization for Asmb3 in project tabs and help filters
Fix a bug in the byte-converters where "ADDA,i" converts to 255
Synchronize active project type with help system content
Do not tab (Messages, Batch Input) panes in the editor and debugger
Avoid layout delay bugs when switching between modes with multiple open projects
Enable "Select All" shortcut for assembler editors
Avoid flashing "Messages" pane when it contains no new messages
Improve selection contrast in assembler text editors
Precent spurious resizes when switching between modes
Enable Asmb5 projects
Upgrade application to use Qt 6.9.3
Re-enable selection via arrow keys in help topic tree
Persist help filters between application sessions
Modify layout of stack trace to prevent intersections between heaps and stack
Temporarily hide globals and heap rendering to prioritize stack rendering
Enable stack trace for Asmb5 projects
In terminal application, output error and warning messages to both console and log file
In terminal application, fix a CTD when executing illegal opcodes
Fix CTD when executing illegal opcodes in GUI application, introduced in #984
Add RISC-V instruction set simulator
Fixed decoding of RISC-V 64-bit compressed instruction `C.SD`
Add `-r,--relocs` flag to readelf CLI utility
Allow reorganizing panes in all project tabs
Rename Microcode 2 (Mc2) level of abstraction to Microarchitecture 2 (MA2) for 6th edition
Fix CTD for Pep/8 and Pep/9 assembler projects
Show object code pane by default in Asmb3 and Asmb5 debuggers
Add comment to Pep/10 operating system on shutdown behavior
Upgrade application to use Qt 6.10.1
Fix register clocking bug in Pep/9 and Pep/10 microcode simulator
Begin work on python bindings for assembler and simulator
Begin implementation of logic-gate (LG1) simulator and editor
Fix bug where not all shared objects/DLLs are found at runtime
On WASM targets, enable selection and copying from batch output
Add a top-level microcode project for one- and two-byte data buses
Re-enable assembler mnemonic and directive highlighting
Give focus to central text editor when creating a new project
Prevent icon from disappearing on active mode button
Significantly improve performance on memory dump
On WASM targets, prevent permanent loss of focus on central text editors
